examples: don't soil your clothes when you play outside!

definitions.text: soiled or likely to soil with dirt or grime
examples: put his dirty feet on the clean sheet
Cinderella did the dirty work while her sisters preened themselves

definitions.text: (of behavior or especially language) characterized by obscenity or indecency
spreading pollution or contamination; especially radioactive contamination
examples: the air near the foundry was always dirty
a dirty bomb releases enormous amounts of long-lived radioactive fallout

definitions.text: contaminated with infecting organisms; ; - Jane Austen
examples: obliged to go into infected rooms

definitions.text: (of color) discolored by impurities; not bright and clear;  is often used in combination
examples: the muddied grey of the sea

definitions.text: obtained illegally or by improper means
expressing or revealing hostility or dislike

examples: used foul means to gain power
there's dirty weather in the offing
